items.q: Because it is farther north, New York is typically ____________________ (cold) than Maryland.
Jennifer seemed to be the ____________________ (happy) of all of the award winners.
Many people feel that acoustic guitars sound ____________________ (good) than electric guitars.
I feel that I have the ____________________ (good) parents in the world.
She is the ____________________ (beautiful) woman I have ever seen.
Luxury cars are ____________________ (expensive) than economy cars.
That is the ____________________ (interesting) painting I have ever seen.
The state of Texas is ____________________ (big) than the state of Florida.
This is the ____________________ (cheap) shirt they had at the store.
This is the ____________________ (bad) weather we've had all year!
It was raining ____________________ hard last night to drive anywhere.
We are ____________________ out of milk and orange juice. We don't have very much left of either one.
I'm sorry, but I'm just ____________________ too tired to go anywhere tonight.
All we need is a ____________________ rain and the garden will grow.
The snow ____________________ covered all the houses and cars.
My friend's house is the same size as my house; in other words, it is ____________________ (as big as / bigger than) my house.
It is ____________________ (healthier / more healthy) to eat fruits and vegetables than it is to eat fried food.
Friends and family are the ____________________ (most important / importantest) people in our lives.
The McLaren F1 is the ____________________ (fastest / most fast) production car in the world.
Many people would argue that cats are ____________________ (cuter / more cute) than dogs.
Basketball players are usually ____________________ (more tall / taller) than baseball players.

Choose the sentence that is grammatically correct. a. Leah is the most intelligentest person I have ever know. b. Leah is the most intelligentest person I have ever known. c. Leah is the most intelligent person I have ever known.
Choose the sentence that is grammatically correct. a. It was extremely windy and bitterly cold today. b. It was extreme windy and bitterly cold today. c. It was extremely windy and nearly cold today.

Choose the sentence that is grammatically correct. a. However running ten miles is difficult, it can also be rewarding. b. Although running ten miles is difficult, it can also be rewarding. c. Similarly running ten miles is difficult, it can also be rewarding.

Choose the sentence that is grammatically correct. a. Whereas we wanted to have dinner outside; however, it was raining. b. We wanted to have dinner outside; conversely, it was raining. c. We wanted to have dinner outside; however, it was raining.
Choose the sentence that is grammatically correct. a. He spoke in a very threateningly voice. b. He spoke in a very threatening voice. c. He spoke in a extremely threatening voice.
Choose the sentence that is grammatically correct. a. Silvio skates betterly than my brother. b. Silvio skates more better than my brother. c. Silvio skates better than my brother.
Choose the sentence that is grammatically correct. a. Ana is as fast a runner than Paulo. b. Ana is faster a runner as Paulo. c. Ana is as fast a runner as Paulo.

Choose the sentence that is grammatically correct. a. Not only did Minna want to learn how to go rock climbing but also swim. b. Not only did Minna want to learn how to go rock climbing but also how to swim. c. Not only did Minna want to learn how to go rock climbing but also to swim.

Choose the sentence that is grammatically correct. a. After two weeks of travel, Isabel felt tired, weak, and sore. b. After two weeks of travel, Isabel felt tired, weak, and she had a sore shoulder. c. After two weeks of travel, Isabel felt tired, weakly, and she had a sore shoulder.

Choose the sentence that is grammatically correct. a. She frequently stopped at the bakery on her way home from work. b. She frequent stopped at the bakery on her way home from work. c. She frequently to stop at the bakery on her way home from work.
Steps in the College Application Process a. appropriate b. inappropriate
My Favorite Rock Stars: Then and Now a. appropriate b. inappropriate
Choosing between a Sport Utility Vehicle and a Hybrid Car a. appropriate b. inappropriate
Why People Should Establish a Regular Fitness Routine a. appropriate b. inappropriate
Living in the City vs. Living in the Suburbs a. appropriate b. inappropriate
Missing piece #1 should be: a. Conclusion b. Point of comparison c. Thesis statement
Missing piece #2 should be: a. Bargain shopping b. Convenience c. Place where shopping happens
Missing piece #3 should be: a. Choices of stores b. Online c. Point of comparison
Missing piece #4 should be: a. Choice of stores b. Saving money c. Speed in finding best deal
Missing piece #5 should be: a. Compare b. Suggest c. Summarize
Missing piece #6 should be: a. point of comparison b. prediction c. thesis statement
likewise
to dump
considerate
to anticipate
pivotal
This dryer operates _____ the principal of solar energy.
No one yet knows the extent _____ the damage done by the flood.
They are very similar, _____ a way.
After you _____ the corner, you'll see the monument.
The hurricane _____ the city at about two o'clock today.
Insects play a _____ role in the ecology of our region.
The word for "soap" is remarkably _____ in the two languages.
If you ever _____ an accident, you'll be glad that you have a cell phone with you.
The unforeseen _____ of the earthquake included flooding and the destruction of many homes.
The senator always seems to have very _____ opinions about everything.
Raul likes swimming, biking, and to go hiking . _________________________
The doctor advised her patient that she should get plenty of rest, get plenty of sleep, and exercising. _________________________
Adam went to the store to purchase milk, eggs, and buy some ice cream . _________________________
When you first visit a city, the most important things you need are a clean place to stay, good food to eat, and enough money to get both of these . _________________________
Tri-athletes compete in three different events: biking, swimming, and they run . _________________________
My cat Phoebe's life consists of sleeping, meowing, and eating . _________________________
People use fireworks for many reasons: to celebrate holidays, for birthdays, and for other special occasions . _________________________
Sometimes Alicia chooses to escape from reality by watching television, to play video games, or surfing the Internet. _________________________
The most expensive items in this company's budget are employee salaries, advertising pieces, and office supplies . _________________________
Something that is frigid is very warm. _______________
Something that is hidden is not easily seen. _______________
A nightmare is a good dream. _______________
A humid climate is one that is very dry. _______________
Gas and coal are two types of fuel . _______________
Compare or contrast going out to see a movie or watching one at home. Choose either the block method or the point-by-point method to discuss your points of comparison.
